Detailed Description

Storage device iterator.

Class StorageDeviceIterator implements a storage devices iterator. A storage device iterator iterates over all storage devices which are currently registered to the root file system.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

StorageDeviceIterator::~StorageDeviceIterator (   ) 
 

StorageDeviceIterator::StorageDeviceIterator (  const StorageDeviceFilterPtr &  filter  )  [explicit, protected]
 

Constructs a storage device iterator. The iterator retrieves storage devices which comply to filter. This is the only constructor since a non-initialized storage device iterator is not allowed.

Parameters:
filter A storage device filter functor.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN StorageDeviceIterator::Accept (  StorageDeviceVisitor &  visitor  )  [static]
 

If all the actually registered devices are ready then the storage device visitor is accepted and TRUE is returned. Accepting the storage device visitor means that for each registered storage device method Visit() of visitor is called. The storage device visitor defines the filter for the storage devices to use. If any of the storage devices is not ready then the visitor can't be accepted and FALSE is returned.

Parameters:
visitor The storage device visitor which operates on the storage devices iterated over.
See also:
StorageDeviceVisitor

StorageDeviceIterator & StorageDeviceIterator::AtomicIncrement (   )  [protected]
 

Increments the iterator to point to the next storage device registered to the root file system and returns a reference to itself. This increment operation does not consider the filter set on construction. Only valid iterators are allowed to be incremented. If this method gets called on the end iterator an assertion holds.

Returns:
Reference to itself incremented to point to the next storage device or being the end iterator.

Reimplemented in RootStorageDeviceIterator.

StorageDevicePtr StorageDeviceIterator::GetStorageDevice (   )  const
 

Returns the storage device the iterator currently points to. Only valid iterators are allowed to be accessed. If the iterator is the end iterator, i.e. the current storage device smart-pointer wraps 0, then an assertion holds.

const WString & StorageDeviceIterator::GetStorageDeviceId (   )  const
 

Returns the storage device Id of the storage device the iterator currently points to. Only valid iterators are allowed to be accessed. If the iterator is the end iterator, i.e. the current storage device smart-pointer wraps 0, then an assertion holds.

void StorageDeviceIterator::Increment (   ) 
 

Increments the iterator to refer to the next storage device or it becomes the end iterator. This increment operation considers the filter set on construction. Only valid iterators are allowed to be incremented. If this method gets called on the end iterator an assertion holds.

BOOLEAN StorageDeviceIterator::IsValid (   )  const
 

Tells if the iterator points to a storage device. This is determined by simply checking the current storage device smart-pointer. If it wraps 0 it is not valid, otherwise it is valid.

Returns:
Tells if the iterator is valid.

Reimplemented in RootStorageDeviceIterator.
